oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Williams Mother's Best show - 1951-02-21 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Two recordings of Hank Williams' Mother's Best show, featuring Louis Buck (announcer), Hank Williams (performer, host), Jerry Rivers (performer) and Audrey Williams (performer), one on February 21, 1951 and the other on February 22, 1951 on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Williams; Audrey Williams; Jerry Rivers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Louis Buck) -- Opening theme -- Hank Williams talks -- Why Should We Try Anymore (Hank Williams) -- Mother's Best plug (Hank Williams and Louis Buck) -- Hank Williams talks -- Low And Lonely (Audrey Williams) -- Hank Williams talks -- Jesus Died For Me (Hank Williams) -- Mother's Best plug (Louis Buck) -- Closing statement (Hank Williams and Louis Buck) -- Closing theme -- [break] -- Opening statement (Louis Buck) -- Opening theme -- Hank Williams talks and introduces the first tune -- Long Gone Lonesome Blues (Hank Williams) -- Hank Williams and Louis Buck talk -- Mother's Best plug (Hank Williams and Louis Buck) -- Audrey Williams talks -- (Last Night) I Heard You Crying In Your Sleep (Audrey Williams) -- Hank Williams talks -- Lonely Tombs (Hank Williams) -- Mother's Best plug (Louis Buck) -- Turkey In The Straw (Jerry Rivers fiddle) -- Closing statement (Hank Williams and Louis Buck) -- Closing theme
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Williams, Audrey, 1923-1975; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971;
